name: Clay Guardian
damage_immunities: acid, poison, psychic; damage from nonmagical, non-adamantine weapons
condition_immunities: charmed, fatigue, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The guardian attacks twice with its slam.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature  it makes a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failure  its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage dealt. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0. A greater restoration spell or similar magic removes the reduction.

special_abilities.name: Constructed Nature
special_abilities.desc: Guardians dont require air, sustenance, or sleep.

special_abilities.name: Acid Absorption
special_abilities.desc: When the guardian is subjected to acid damage, it instead regains hit points equal to the acid damage dealt.

special_abilities.name: Berserk
special_abilities.desc: When the guardian starts its turn while bloodied , roll a d6. On a 6, the guardian goes berserk. While berserk, the guardian attacks the nearest creature it can see. If it canâ€™t reach a creature, it attacks an object. The guardian stays berserk until it is destroyed or restored to full hit points.

special_abilities.name: Bloodied Haste
special_abilities.desc: While the guardian is bloodied, its speed is doubled, it gains a +2 bonus to AC, it has advantage on Dexterity saving throws , and it can use its slam as a bonus action.

special_abilities.name: Immutable Form
special_abilities.desc: The guardian is immune to any effect that would alter its form.

special_abilities.name: Magic Resistance
special_abilities.desc: The guardian has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.
